title: Emmerdale airs Ellis Chapman's exit month after actor Asan N’Jie was axed

Emmerdale has revealed Ellis Chapman's exit from the ITV soap, airing his final scenes a month on from the news the actor who played him had been axed.

Asan N’Jie was sacked from the ITV soap after an incident with Hollyoaks star Jamie Lomas at the TV Choice Awards in September.

Emmerdale announced he had been dropped following the incident, while already filmed storylines continued to air - despite a rewrite in the scripts for those scenes yet to be filmed.

On Thursday, the soap finally revealed how Ellis would be leaving the soap a day after what were later confirmed to be his final scenes aired.

(Image: ITV)

Wednesday's episode saw Ellis' brother Billy worried about him as he injured his arm after catching it on a nail.

Viewers speculated over whether he might die as a result, while the character carried out work for his dad.

But it was revealed he was alive and well on Thursday's two episodes, with Billy telling new flame Dawn and Ellis' dad Al of his whereabouts.

(Image: Getty Images)

Confirming he had left the village and was visiting his mum Jessie Grant, who also recently left, his exit was revealed.

Billy said to Al: "Don't freak out but he's got another job," adding: "I don't think you could compete with Dubai."

As Al asked when he would be leaving, Billy added: "Any time now," before explaining mum Jessie was swamped with her new job and needed Ellis' help.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: WireImage)

Later on it was confirmed he'd left the village, with the second episode confirming further details.

Dawn said Ellis had gone, with Billy telling her: "Al has been working him into the ground, it's making him ill.

"So I called mum...she rang with a job. It might only be a couple of months, maybe less, but at least he's getting away from [Al]."

(Image: ITV)

While Billy and Dawn discussed when Ellis might return, fans know this is not going to happen.

Taking to Twitter after the scenes, viewers realised this was the last of the character on screen.

One fan said: "So I’m guessing that’s the last we’ve seen of both Ellis," as another agreed: "So that ellis exit storyline then."

Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV with an extra episode at 8pm on Thursdays.
description: Emmerdale actor Asan N’Jie was axed from the ITV soap after an incident at the TV Choice Awards in September
